creator: yugene1986@gmail.com
text:
We need adding for __evalVar function for possibility setting different identificators of JMeter variable which need to interpret.
Say, if we set ${__evalVar(string,#,#)} that function will search in "string" sets of #someName# and replace it with "someName" variable value.
Is it possible?

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Hello,
I don't understand what you want to do is it this:
Can you give a complete example of input, what is passed in parameters of function and resulting output ?

Thank you

creator: yugene1986@gmail.com
text:
OK, examples bellow

string="some_string_${jvar}_here"->jvar="is"->${evalVar(string)}->"some_string_is_here"

string="some_string_${jvar}_here"->jvar="is"->${evalVar(string,${,})}->"some_string_is_here"

string="some_string_#jvar#_here"->jvar="is"->${evalVar(string,#,#)}->"some_string_is_here"

I mean can you expand evalVar function with configurable variables syntax settings

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Marking as duplicate as fixing 54066 would provide a solution to this one
